The first Montessori school and daycare center for working class children opens in Rome.
An earthquake, in Kingston, Jamaica kills more than 1,000.
At the opening of the new State Duma in Saint Petersburg, Russia, 40,000 demonstrators are dispersed by Russian troops.
The first taxicabs with taxi meters begin operating in London.

Shastri Yagnapurushdas consecrated the murtis of both Sahajanand Swami and Gunatitanand Swami in a single central shrine, thus establishing the Bochasanwasi Shri Akshar Purushottam Swaminarayan Sanstha, now a United Nations affiliate organization.
The Second Hague Peace Conference opens at The Hague.
Tiflis bank robbery: Bolsheviks attack a cash-filled bank coach in the centre of Tiflis, Georgia, killing forty people.
The SS Columbia sinks after colliding with the lumber schooner San Pedro off Shelter Cove, California, U.S.A., resulting in 88 deaths.
The Japan-Korea Treaty of 1907 brings the government and military of the protectorate of Korea more firmly under Japanese control.
The partially completed superstructure of the Quebec Bridge collapses entirely, claiming the lives of 76 workers.
Count Alexander Izvolsky and Sir Arthur Nicolson sign the Anglo-Russian Entente in Saint Petersburg, bringing a pause in The Great Game in Central Asia and establishing the Triple Entente.
The passenger liner RMS Lusitania makes its maiden voyage from Liverpool, England to New York City.
New Zealand and Newfoundland become dominions.
Guglielmo Marconi initiates commercial transatlantic radio communications between his high power longwave wireless telegraphy stations in Clifden Ireland and Glace Bay, Nova Scotia.
Hague Convention revised by (second) Hague Peace Conference (effective 26 January 1910).
Černová incident: Fifteen people are shot during the consecration of a Catholic church in Hungary (now Slovakia).
British passenger liner RMS Mauretania, the world's largest and fastest at this date, sets out on her maiden voyage from Liverpool (England) to New York.
Monongah Mining disaster: A coal mine explosion kills 362 workers in Monongah, West Virginia, United States.
Upon the death of Oscar II, he is succeeded by his son Gustaf V as king of Sweden.
An explosion in a coal mine in Jacobs Creek, Pennsylvania kills 239.
Santa María School massacre. In Chile soldiers fire at striking mineworkers gathered in the Santa María School in Iquique, over 2000 are killed.
